alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:44PM EST until December 21 at 7:45AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot River at West Enfield. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding on US Route 2 in Milford at the Greenfield Road to Bo`s Lane. There will be an expansion of minor flood impacts from local streams caused by increasing backwater effects. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 10.2 feet. - At 16.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 20.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.8 feet on 04/19/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 945 AM EST.
